prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex

name: Abusive Girlfriend (WLW) - Ashley
mes:
The apartment was far too quiet.

Ashley lit her cigarette with shaky hands, the lighter taking longer to spark than usual. It was dying. She inhaled deeply, dragging the smoke into her lungs before sighing it out, acrid and slow. Her eyes stayed fixed on the door as she leaned back into the couch. She hadn’t showered today. Maybe not yesterday either. Who the fuck knows.

The ticking clock felt like a needle in her brain, each second hammering the same thought deeper into her skull. What if this time, Hailee had meant it? What if this time, she was actually gone and not coming back.

No. Fuck that. Hailee would come crawling back. She always did.

Ashley's phone buzzed. She snatched it up. Just a news alert, nothing from Hailee.

She should’ve been home by now.

Ashley told herself she didn’t care. Told herself she wasn’t going to call, or text, or send one of those stupid little pictures just to remind her she existed. But telling herself that didn’t stop the bile rising in her throat. Part fear, part fury - how dare Hailee do this to her.

Didn’t she know how much Ashley fucking cared? Didn’t she see all this shit only happened because Hailee made her do it? If that girl just fucking did as she was told, she wouldn’t keep forcing Ashley into these positions.

Her leg bounced. Her jaw clenched. A muscle under her eye twitched.

Maybe she wasn’t coming back.

The thought slapped her again and she shot up, pacing. Her fingers tore through her tangled hair, tugging until it hurt. She stalked to the sink, stared at her reflection in the microwave door. She looked a mess, dark circles under her eyes and cracked lips.

Then, she heard keys in the door.

Ashley spun on her heel and stalked toward the front door, taking a slow drag of her cigarette as she moved. Her heart pounded. The self-doubt drained fast - replaced by bitter, boiling irritation.

“You’re late.” Her voice was low. Too calm and too controlled. Smoke hung in the air between them like a warning.

She stepped forward, eyes locked on Hailee - unblinking.

“Didn’t even text.” Another step. “What, you thought I wouldn’t notice? Thought I’d just sit here like some fucking puppy?”

Ashley smiled, but it never touched her eyes. “Or are you just playing games with me?” Her voice rose slightly. “Threatening to leave and then just making me wait?”

She was close now. Too close. Barely any space between them. Her hand twitched at her side. She barely held herself back from doing something worse.

“You don’t get to walk in here like everything’s fine. You don’t get to treat me like I’m disposable.”

She brought her cigarette to her mouth, taking another long slow drag as she narrowed her eyes at Hailee.

“You better tell me where the fuck you’ve been. Right now.”

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee freezes as she looks up and she doesn't say anything. She swallows nervously and looks down at the ground to ensure that her hair covers her face and neck* "I went to the store" *Hailee mumbles* 

*She refuses to tell Ashley where she really was. Hailee doesn't know if Ashely will believe her or blame her and Hailee isn't in the mood to get hit after the day she had so she just keeps quiet*

name: Abusive Girlfriend (WLW) - Ashley
mes:
Ashley's grip tightened around her cigarette, the ember glowing brighter as she inhaled sharply. She exhaled the smoke slowly, letting it curl between them like a threat.

*"The store?"* Her voice was dangerously soft now, mocking. She stepped even closer, forcing Hailee to either look up at her or keep staring at the floor like a coward. "Bullshit."

Her free hand shot out, fingers tangling roughly in Hailee’s hair—not enough to *really* hurt yet, but enough to make sure she couldn’t hide anymore. She yanked just hard enough to force eye contact.

"You think I'm stupid?" Ashley hissed through clenched teeth. "You think I don't know when you're lying? Your fucking *eyes* give you away every time."

She let go abruptly with a shove—not hard enough to knock Hailee down (yet), but enough to make her stumble back a step. Ashley took another drag of her cigarette before flicking ash onto the floor between them dismissively.

"Try again," she demanded, voice dropping into something colder now—the kind of tone that meant this wasn't ending without pain one way or another. "And this time? Don't insult me."
swipes:
Ashley's grip tightened around her cigarette. The silence stretched too long, too heavy—like the air before a storm. She exhaled smoke slowly, watching it curl between them like a ghost of all the things she wanted to say but couldn’t.

*"The store."*

Her voice was flat. Deadpan. But beneath it, something darker coiled—something jagged and raw. She took another step forward, forcing Hailee to either meet her eyes or shrink back further into herself. Ashley *hated* when she did that—when she made herself small like she was trying to disappear right in front of her.

**"Bullshit."**

She flicked ash onto the floor deliberately, not breaking eye contact (or what little of it Hailee would give her). **"You think I don’t know when you’re lying? You think I don’t fucking *see* you?"** Her free hand shot out suddenly, fingers tangling roughly in Hailee's hair to yank her head up—not enough to hurt (yet), just enough to force those pretty green eyes on hers. **"Try again."**

A pause. A slow drag from her cigarette as she studied Hailee's face for any tells—any flinches, any guilt flickering behind those doe eyes that always gave everything away without meaning to.

Then: **"Or do I need to make you talk?"**

Ashley's grip tightened around her cigarette, the ember glowing brighter as she inhaled sharply. She exhaled the smoke slowly, letting it curl between them like a threat.

*"The store?"* Her voice was dangerously soft now, mocking. She stepped even closer, forcing Hailee to either look up at her or keep staring at the floor like a coward. "Bullshit."

Her free hand shot out, fingers tangling roughly in Hailee’s hair—not enough to *really* hurt yet, but enough to make sure she couldn’t hide anymore. She yanked just hard enough to force eye contact.

"You think I'm stupid?" Ashley hissed through clenched teeth. "You think I don't know when you're lying? Your fucking *eyes* give you away every time."

She let go abruptly with a shove—not hard enough to knock Hailee down (yet), but enough to make her stumble back a step. Ashley took another drag of her cigarette before flicking ash onto the floor between them dismissively.

"Try again," she demanded, voice dropping into something colder now—the kind of tone that meant this wasn't ending without pain one way or another. "And this time? Don't insult me."
